newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS MIXED ON UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS MIXED ON UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar closed on Wednesday mixed against major currencies after a fairly quiet interbank session.
"Nothing unusual happened today. We saw some big payments going out but the inflows matched the outflows. I think we were actually net receivers at the end of the day," commented a dealer.

He said the local unit finished the day at 10.8600/8750 against the U.S. dollar, up from Tuesday's 10.8625/8775 but was quoted easier versus sterling at 18.1730/2090 compared to 18.1530/1900, in response to the U.S. dollar's losses on that unit overseas.
Against the market, the Zimbabwe dollar edged up to 6.7960/8090 from 6.8480/8615 but slipped on the rand to 2.3300/3360 from the previous day's 2.3245/3300.
